item.title: Deadline looms as Anthropic rejects Pentagon demands it remove AI safeguards
item.description: The Defense Department has been feuding with Anthropic over military uses of its artificial intelligence tools. At stake are hundreds of millions of dollars in contracts and access to some of the most advanced AI on the planet.

item.title: These major issues have brought together Democrats and Republicans in states
item.description: Across the country, Republicans and Democrats have found bipartisan agreement on regulating artificial intelligence and data centers. But it's not just big tech aligning the two parties.

item.title: Secretly rewritten nuclear safety rules are made public
item.description: The Energy Department made the rules public a month after NPR reported about their existence. The rules slash requirements for security and environmental protections.

item.title: With help from monkeys, scientists build a leaner AI brain
item.description: Scientists have created an AI version of a monkey brain that recognizes images without requiring the massive computing power of existing AI systems.

item.title: Hegseth threatens to blacklist Anthropic over 'woke AI' concerns
item.description: The company's Claude chatbot is one of the few AI systems cleared for use in classified settings. But a standoff between Anthropic and the Trump administration is putting its government work at risk.
